titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to Albion College Catalogs, etc. Cubb.00033
titlestmt.author: Kathy Kerns

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-03-30 15:52:15 -0700.

did.unittitle: Albion College (formerly Wesleyan Seminary and Female Collegiate Institute)

physdesc.extent: Catalogs for 1870/71, (called Yearbook through 1921, announcements for next year included) 1892/93, 1896/97-1899/1900, 1903/04, 1908/09-1909/10, 1911/12-1925/26 (beginning the next year using the years of the announcements on cover, but there is no break here) 1926/27-1945/46, 1947/48-1948/49, 1950/51, 1952/53, 1954/55, 1957/59-1961/63, 1965/66-1967/69, 1971/72, 1976-77

did.abstract: Located in Albion, Michigan. Private college affiliated with the United Methodist Church. Chartered as Spring Arbor Academy in 1835. Moved from Spring Arbor to Albion in 1839. In 1849 charter amended to include a Female College and name changed to Wesleyan Seminary and Female Collegiate Institute (women only). Became coeducational in 1861 and name changed to Albion College.
